page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF PURITON
page.content: Puriton is a well established village,mentioned in the original {Domesday survey.}It has a population of about 2,000 people who live mostly on estates which surround the central part of the village.The estates have been built up in the last 20 years and comprise of a mixture of types of houses, terraced semi and detached. The village is built along a secondary road which connects a number of outlying villages to the {M5 }at exit 23,and the main road to {Bridgwater,}it's self an historic town linked with the{Monmouth Rebellion } of 1685,and was an important trading port in the 17th and 18th centuries.
